intro: Hemigenia ciliata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hemigenia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves with finely toothed margins. Its flowers are typically pale purple to blue and are borne in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens. Hemigenia ciliata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks.
